column4: continue to run in low graphics mode, uninstall the nvidia drivers.
Which NVIDIA driver are you using? The open source or the proprietary?
I just tried installing the proprietary with the software called 'additional drivers'
but I can't get to low graphics mode,  all I got was tty1, a console with no desktop
I suggest disabling the proprietary and going with the open source ones.
startx
type startx, hit enter.
it shows a blank screen
no unity
if you logged in via the terminal where you're at, type startx and is there anything showing?
also, follow wols's directions
yes there is, just a blank sscreen
I mean, I can see the desktop, but no unity
Alt-F2. Type in unity, hit enter.
alt f2 doesn't do anything
Press ctrl-alt-f7 and see if anything shows
yes, some random text
the last line is 'mountall: Disconnected from Plymouth               [OK]'
Since we cannot see what's on the screen, I am going to suggest doing a reinstall.
a reinstall of what?
The current version of ubuntu you're running.
that's nott convenient, I just lost a lot of time setting up my new system
This is out of my reach. Sorry.
